avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of the sometimes moderate wind the wind slabs will increase in size. The wind slabs must be evaluated with care and prudence. In isolated cases the dry avalanches are large and can be released by a single winter sport participant, caution is to be exercised in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain, as well as adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas above approximately 2200 m.
Avalanches can penetrate deep layers and reach quite a large size.
The current avalanche situation calls for careful route selection.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Fresh wind slabs above the tree line.

snowpackStructure.comment:
20 to 40 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen since Sunday. The moderate wind will transport the new snow. The fresh snow and the wind slabs are lying on a crust below approximately 2300 m.
Faceted weak layers exist in the old snowpack in particular on shady slopes. Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted.
In all aspects snow depths vary greatly at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions, depending on the infuence of the wind.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The fresh and older wind slabs can be released easily or naturally above approximately 2000 m, caution is to be exercised adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas, as well as at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example.
In isolated cases the avalanches can be released in the faceted old snow and reach medium size.
The avalanche prone locations are sometimes covered with new snow and are barely recognisable because of the poor visibility. Backcountry touring calls for caution and restraint.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The fresh and somewhat older wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
15 to 20 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen since Sunday. The wind will transport the snow. In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on old snow containing large grains. In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2000 m, depending on the infuence of the wind.
Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas at elevated altitudes hardly any snow is lying.

avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of new snow and strong wind the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent. The fresh snow and very particularly the sometimes deep wind slabs can be released easily, or, in isolated cases naturally above the tree line, especially on very steep slopes adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls.

Dry avalanches can be triggered in the old snowpack and reach large size in isolated cases in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation.
Apart from the danger of being buried, restraint should be exercised as well in view of the danger of avalanches sweeping people along and giving rise to falls. This also applies in areas where the snow cover is rather shallow.

The avalanche prone locations are sometimes covered with new snow and are therefore difficult to recognise. Backcountry touring calls for experience and restraint.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The fresh snow and in particular the wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area over a wide area 30 to 40 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen since Saturday above approximately 1300 m. Some snow will fall.
In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust. Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted and weak.
In high Alpine regions snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.
In all altitude zones only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year.

avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of the sometimes strong wind the wind slabs will increase in size. The fresh snow and very particularly the resulting wind slabs can be released easily, or, in isolated cases naturally above the tree line, especially on very steep slopes adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls.
Dry avalanches can in isolated cases be triggered in the old snowpack and reach quite a large size in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation.
Apart from the danger of being buried, restraint should be exercised as well in view of the danger of avalanches sweeping people along and giving rise to falls. This also applies in areas where the snow cover is rather shallow.
Backcountry touring calls for experience and restraint.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The fresh snow and in particular the wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Up to 30 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen since Sunday. Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted and weak. In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust.
In high Alpine regions snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.
In all altitude zones only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The sometimes strong wind will transport the new snow. The fresh snow and very particularly the mostly small wind slabs can be released easily, or, in isolated cases naturally above the tree line, especially on very steep slopes adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls.

On very steep shady slopes the avalanches can be released in the old snow and reach medium size, in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation in particular.

Apart from the danger of being buried, restraint should be exercised as well in view of the danger of avalanches sweeping people along and giving rise to falls.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The fresh snow and in particular the wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust. Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted and weak.
In high Alpine regions snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.
In all altitude zones only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year.
